translated: “Noble lady, I do not go for alms because my body is large.

original: srog gi phyir tsher ba dgag pa'i don du bsod snyoms la rgyu'o //
analyzed: srog gi phyir tsher ba dgag pa'i don du bsod snyoms la rgyu'o //
translated: I go for alms in order to stop the pain of life.”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor; da dung yang tshor bas 'phrogs sam /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor; da dung yang tshor bas 'phrogs sam /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, are you still carried away by feelings?”

original: smras pa / che zhe /
analyzed: smras pa / che zhe /
translated: “Noble lady,

original: bdag ni tshor bas mi 'phrogs mod kyi tshor ba dgag pa'i phyir bsod snyoms la rgyu'o //
analyzed: bdag ni tshor bas mi 'phrogs mod kyi tshor ba dgag pa'i phyir bsod snyoms la rgyu'o //
translated: I am not carried away by feelings, but I go for alms in order to stop feelings.”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor; nyon mongs pa med pa ni mtshungs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor; nyon mongs pa med pa ni mtshungs pa med pa ste /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, the absence of afflictions is incomparable.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa ni lus dang / sems kyi tshor ba myong ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa ni lus dang / sems kyi tshor ba myong ba ma mchis so //
translated: Those who abide in the absence of afflictions do not experience physical or mental feelings.

original: nyon mongs @319b pa med pa ni lus dang / sems dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma lags so //🔽nyon mongs pa med pa ni dga' ba'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs @319b pa med pa ni lus dang / sems dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma lags so // nyon mongs pa med pa ni dga' ba'am /
translated: The absence of afflictions is not associated with body or mind.

original: mi dga' ba skyed ba mi bgyid do //
analyzed: mi dga' ba skyed ba mi bgyid do //
translated: The absence of afflictions does not give rise to joy or🔽displeasure.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni su la'ang nyon mongs pas nye bar gnas pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni su la'ang nyon mongs pas nye bar gnas pa ma mchis so //
translated: He is free from afflictions, for he is not afflicted by anything.

original: gzhan yang / gang gi slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis btsun pa rab 'byor nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang gi slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis btsun pa rab 'byor nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan na /
translated: Moreover, since the Blessed One has declared the Venerable Subhūti to be foremost among those who dwell free from afflictions,

original: ci'i slad du ni nyon mongs pa med pa nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ci'i slad du ni nyon mongs pa med pa nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bgyi /
translated: why is it called ‘freedom from afflictions’?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: che zhe / dmigs pa med pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral ba yin no; ;smras pa /
analyzed: che zhe / dmigs pa med pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral ba yin no; ;smras pa /
translated: “Mahāprajāpatī, freedom from afflictions that is free from reference points is free from the dust of desire.”🔽Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ram /
translated: is it because of freedom from afflictions that one becomes free from desire?”

original: smras pa / che zhe /
analyzed: smras pa / che zhe /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: “No, Mahāprajāpatī.”🔽Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī said,

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'o na nyon mongs pa med pa de ji ltar 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral bar gyur /
analyzed: 'o na nyon mongs pa med pa de ji ltar 'dod chags kyi rdul dang bral bar gyur /
translated: then how does freedom from afflictions become free from the dust of desire?”

original: smras pa / che zhe /
analyzed: smras pa / che zhe /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“Mahāprajāpatī,

original: nyon mongs pa med par bstan pa 'di ni bshad pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par bstan pa 'di ni bshad pa tsam du zad do //
translated: “This teaching of the absence of afflictions is just an explanation.

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor ci; nyon mongs pa med pa la bshad pa mchis sam /🔽smras pa / che zhe /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor ci; nyon mongs pa med pa la bshad pa mchis sam / smras pa / che zhe /
translated: ” Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, is there an explanation of the absence of afflictions?”

original: med do / smras pa /
analyzed: med do / smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied, “No, Śāriputra, there is not.”

original: btsun ba rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun ba rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: gal te nyon mongs pa med pa la bshad pa ma mchis na ci zhig chad cing bzhugs /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa med pa la bshad pa ma mchis na ci zhig chad cing bzhugs /
translated: if there is no explanation of the absence of afflictions, what is it that is explained?”

original: smras pa / che zhe /
analyzed: smras pa / che zhe /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Śāriputra,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams ni tha snyad tsam gyis tha snyad du 'dogs par zad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams ni tha snyad tsam gyis tha snyad du 'dogs par zad do //
translated: the hearers of the Blessed One are just designations, and they designate through mere convention.”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ji tsam du brjod pa mchis @320a *//
analyzed: ji tsam du brjod pa mchis @320a *//
translated: to the extent that there is expression,

original: pa de tsam du tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: pa de tsam du tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: to that extent there is designation.

original: ji tsam du tha snyad 'dogs pa de tsam du phyin ci log go /
analyzed: ji tsam du tha snyad 'dogs pa de tsam du phyin ci log go /
translated: To the extent that there is designation, to that extent there is error.

original: ji tsam du phyin ci log pa de tsam du rtsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji tsam du phyin ci log pa de tsam du rtsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that there is error, to that extent there is dispute.

original: ji tsam du rtsod pa de tsam du dge sbyong gi chos ma lags so //
analyzed: ji tsam du rtsod pa de tsam du dge sbyong gi chos ma lags so //
translated: To the extent that there is dispute, to that extent there is no dharma of mendicancy.”

original: smras pa / che zhe /
analyzed: smras pa / che zhe /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Śāriputra,

original: 'o na dag sbyong gi chos gang yin /
analyzed: 'o na dag sbyong gi chos gang yin /
translated: “Well then, what is the Dharma of purification?”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni tha snyad ma mchis pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni tha snyad ma mchis pa /
translated: the Dharma of purification is beyond convention.

original: phyin ci ma log pa /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa /
translated: It is without error,

original: rtsod pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: and is beyond dispute.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni chos dang / chos ma lags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni chos dang / chos ma lags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of purification is free from Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni chags pa dang / ma chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni chags pa dang / ma chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of purification is free from attachment and non-attachment.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni yul ma mchis pa dang / yul ma lags pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni yul ma mchis pa dang / yul ma lags pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of purification is beyond objects and non-objects.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni chags pa ma mchis pa dang / ma bcings /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni chags pa ma mchis pa dang / ma bcings /
translated: The Dharma of purification is without attachment, without bondage,

original: ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: ma grol ba'o //
translated: and without liberation.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni sems ma mchis pa ste; sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni sems ma mchis pa ste; sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of purification is without mind, free from mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni chog shes pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of purification is contentment.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni phrag dog dang / chags pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni phrag dog dang / chags pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of purification is the abandonment of jealousy and attachment.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of purification is having few desires and being content.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni 'dod pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni 'dod pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is free from all desires.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa dang / zhen pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa dang / zhen pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is to transcend all objects and be without attachment.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni phung po'i bdud las nges par grol ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni phung po'i bdud las nges par grol ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is to be liberated from the māra of the aggregates.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is to be without afflictions.

original: @320b nyon mongs pa'i bdud las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: @320b nyon mongs pa'i bdud las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: It is to transcend the māra of the afflictions.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is unborn.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni 'chi bdag gi bdud dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni 'chi bdag gi bdud dang bral ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is free from the māra of death.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni g-yo ba ma mchis pa dang / rlom sems ma mchis pa dang / rtogs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par ma sgribs pa dang / spyad pa ma lags pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni g-yo ba ma mchis pa dang / rlom sems ma mchis pa dang / rtogs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par ma sgribs pa dang / spyad pa ma lags pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is without movement, without conceit, without conceptualization, without obscuration, and without practice.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni bdud kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'o; ;dge sbyong gi chos ni blang ba ma mchis pa dang / dor ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni bdud kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'o; ;dge sbyong gi chos ni blang ba ma mchis pa dang / dor ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is without acceptance and without rejection.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is free from arising and perishing.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni lha'i bu'i bdud dang ma 'bags pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni lha'i bu'i bdud dang ma 'bags pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is unstained by the māras of the gods.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni yid la byed pa ma mchis pa dang / thams cad du gos pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni yid la byed pa ma mchis pa dang / thams cad du gos pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is without mental activity and without being sullied by anything.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni mngon par zhen pa ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni mngon par zhen pa ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is without attachment, without signs, and free from all signs.

original: dge sbyong gi chos ni khams dang / khams ma lags pa'i tshul thams cad kyis bcos pa ma lags pa dang / bgrang ba dang / bral ba dang / gnas ma mchis pa dang / nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos ni khams dang / khams ma lags pa'i tshul thams cad kyis bcos pa ma lags pa dang / bgrang ba dang / bral ba dang / gnas ma mchis pa dang / nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: The Dharma of mendicancy is not fabricated by any mode of the elements or non-elements, is beyond enumeration, is without location, and is equal to space.

original: dge sbyong gi chos bstan pa 'di bshad pa na sgo khang der lha'i bu gang dag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dus pa de dag las lha'i bu bzhi stong chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos bstan pa 'di bshad pa na sgo khang der lha'i bu gang dag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dus pa de dag las lha'i bu bzhi stong chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: When this teaching of the Dharma of the ascetic was being taught, among the gods who had gathered in the gateway to hear the Dharma, four thousand gods purified the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye that sees phenomena.

original: rgya chen po la mos pa'i lha'i bu lnga brgya ni bud med de'i spobs pa thos nas bla na med pa yang dag @321a *//
analyzed: rgya chen po la mos pa'i lha'i bu lnga brgya ni bud med de'i spobs pa thos nas bla na med pa yang dag @321a *//
translated: Five hundred gods who were devoted to the Great Vehicle, having heard the eloquence of that woman, gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed,

original: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti thought this:

original: che zhe 'di 'di ltar spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de ni ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: che zhe 'di 'di ltar spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de ni ngo mtshar te /
translated: “It is amazing that this elder sister has such perfect eloquence.

original: che zhe 'di'i spobs pa 'di 'dra ba las na 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa yin par the tshom med do snyam mo //
analyzed: che zhe 'di'i spobs pa 'di 'dra ba las na 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa yin par the tshom med do snyam mo //
translated: Since this elder sister has such eloquence, there is no doubt that she is an emanation of the Tathāgata.”

original: de nas bud med de'i sems kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems shes nas gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas bud med de'i sems kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems shes nas gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the thought of the woman penetrated the mind of the venerable Subhūti, and she said to the elder Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'di ltar 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa yin par the tshom med do snyam du dgongs pa de ni ji ltar dgongs pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa yin par the tshom med do snyam du dgongs pa de ni ji ltar dgongs pa de bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have thought, ‘This is surely an emanation of the Tathāgata.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin nyid thugs su chud ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang de bzhin nyid khong du chud de /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin nyid thugs su chud ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang de bzhin nyid khong du chud de /
translated: Just as the Tathāgata has realized suchness, so have I realized suchness.

original: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I am an emanation of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de bdag gi de bzhin nyid kyang de nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba dang; 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de bdag gi de bzhin nyid kyang de nyid de /
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata’s form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the same as my suchness.

original: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I am an emanation of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma lags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma lags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata never becomes otherwise than suchness.

original: bdag gi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa @321b dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma lags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa @321b dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma lags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The suchness that is my suchness and the suchness that is the suchness of all sentient beings never becomes otherwise than suchness.🔽Therefore, I am an emanation of the Tathāgata.

original: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul ba'o; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni res 'ga' de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba ma lags la bdag gi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de'ang res 'ga' de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba ma
analyzed: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul ba'o; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni res 'ga' de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba ma lags la bdag gi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de'ang res 'ga' de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba ma
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is not sometimes suchness and sometimes not suchness. The suchness that is my suchness is not sometimes suchness and sometimes not suchness.

original: lags kyi / rtag tu de bzhin nyid de kho na lags so //
analyzed: lags kyi / rtag tu de bzhin nyid de kho na lags so //
translated: It is always just suchness.

original: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I am an emanation of the Tathāgata.

original: bdag gi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: bdag gi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang lags pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness of myself, the suchness of all sentient beings, and the suchness of all phenomena is the real, the non-other.

original: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I am an emanation of the Tathāgata.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bud med de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bud med de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to that woman, “

original: che zhe / ci khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus bdag gi sems shes sam /
analyzed: che zhe / ci khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus bdag gi sems shes sam /
translated: Noble lady, do you know my mind through the power of the Tathāgata,

original: 'on te rang gi shes pas shes /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi shes pas shes /
translated: or do you know it through your own knowledge?”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: She replied, “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: nyan thos rnams sam /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams sam /
translated: whether it is the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams sam; byang chub sems dpa' rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams sam; byang chub sems dpa' rnams sam /
translated: the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas,

original: drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: or the sages endowed with the five kinds of supernormal knowledge,

original: sems can gzhan gyi sems shes pa de dag thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi @322a *//🔽mthus gzhan gyi sems shes pa lags so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi sems shes pa de dag thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi @322a *// mthus gzhan gyi sems shes pa lags so //
translated: All those who know the minds of others do so through the power of the Buddha.

original: de ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa gang lags pa de'ang sangs rgyas kyi mthus mkhyen pa lags so //

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: gru dang / stegs dang / zam pa dang / lam po che la bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gru dang / stegs dang / zam pa dang / lam po che la bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal ba de bzhin du /
translated: one does not request forbearance from a boat, a bank, a bridge, or a highway.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: gang gi sems gru dang / stegs dang / zam pa dang / lam po che dang 'dra ba de la ni bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang gi sems gru dang / stegs dang / zam pa dang / lam po che dang 'dra ba de la ni bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal lo //
translated: One should not ask for forgiveness from those whose minds are like a boat, a bridge, a causeway, a road, or a highway.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byis pa rnams la bzod pa gsol ba 'tshal gyi 'phags pa rnams la ni bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la bzod pa gsol ba 'tshal gyi 'phags pa rnams la ni bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal lo //
translated: one should ask for forgiveness from the childish, but not from the noble ones.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: gang dag la gnod sems dang / khro ba dang / bag la nyal skye ba dag la ni bzod pa gsol 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: gang dag la gnod sems dang / khro ba dang / bag la nyal skye ba dag la ni bzod pa gsol 'tshal gyi /
translated: one should ask for forgiveness from those in whom malice, anger, and latent tendencies arise,

original: gang dag la mi skye ba de dag la ni bzod pa gsol ma 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang dag la mi skye ba de dag la ni bzod pa gsol ma 'tshal lo //
translated: but not from those in whom they do not arise.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: dper na / me 'bar ba ni zhi bar bgyi 'tshal gyi; me mi 'bar ba ni zhi bar bgyi mi 'tshal ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / me 'bar ba ni zhi bar bgyi 'tshal gyi; me mi 'bar ba ni zhi bar bgyi mi 'tshal ba de bzhin du /
translated: just as one should extinguish a blazing fire, but not a fire that is not blazing,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: in the same way, Venerable Subhūti,

original: gang dag gi nyon mongs pa 'bar ba de dag la ni bzod pa gsol 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: gang dag gi nyon mongs pa 'bar ba de dag la ni bzod pa gsol 'tshal gyi /
translated: one should ask for forgiveness from those whose afflictions are blazing,🔽but not from those whose afflictions are not blazing.

original: gang @325a *// dag nyon mongs pa med pa de dag la ni bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang @325a *// dag nyon mongs pa med pa de dag la ni bzod pa gsol mi 'tshal lo //
translated: Those who are free from afflictions do not need to be asked for forgiveness.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bud med de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bud med de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to that woman, “

original: che zhe / khyod ci zhig 'dod na 'di ltar seng ge'i sgra sgrogs /
analyzed: che zhe / khyod ci zhig 'dod na 'di ltar seng ge'i sgra sgrogs /
translated: Noble lady, what is it that you wish for, that you roar the lion’s roar like this?”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: She replied, “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: gang 'dod pa mchis pa des ni sengge'i sgra sgrogs mi nus so; ;gang dag ci'ang mi 'dod pa de dag ni sengge'i sgra sgrogs par bgyid do //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa mchis pa des ni sengge'i sgra sgrogs mi nus so; ;gang dag ci'ang mi 'dod pa de dag ni sengge'i sgra sgrogs par bgyid do //
translated: those who have wishes are unable to roar the lion’s roar. Those who have no wishes at all roar the lion’s roar.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: dmigs pa mchis pa la ni 'dod pa mchis la /
analyzed: dmigs pa mchis pa la ni 'dod pa mchis la /
translated: Those who have reference points have wishes.

original: gang la dmigs pa ma mchis pa de la ni sengge'i sgra ci'ang ma mchis so //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa ma mchis pa de la ni sengge'i sgra ci'ang ma mchis so //
translated: Those who have no reference points have no wishes at all, and so they roar the lion’s roar.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba mchis pa la ni 'dod pa mchis la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba mchis pa la ni 'dod pa mchis la /
translated: Those who have the view of the transitory collection have wishes.

original: gang la lta ba'i rnam pa ma mchis pa de la ni sengge'i sgra ci'ang ma mchis so //
analyzed: gang la lta ba'i rnam pa ma mchis pa de la ni sengge'i sgra ci'ang ma mchis so //
translated: Those who have no aspects of the view have no wishes at all, and so they roar the lion’s roar.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: gzhan yang / ci zhig bzhed pa las len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar gyur; smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang / ci zhig bzhed pa las len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar gyur; smras pa /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Subhūti, has your mind been liberated from the defilements without grasping?”

original: che zhe / 'dod pa yod pa la ni rnam par grol ba ci'ang med do //
analyzed: che zhe / 'dod pa yod pa la ni rnam par grol ba ci'ang med do //
translated: “Great being, there is no liberation whatsoever for those who have grasping.”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti said, “Sister,

original: gang bzhed pas len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba de bzhin du bdag kyang de lta bu'i 'jug pas zhugs so //
analyzed: gang bzhed pas len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol ba de bzhin du bdag kyang de lta bu'i 'jug pas zhugs so //
translated: just as your mind has been liberated from the defilements without grasping, so too has my mind entered that very mode.

original: bdag kyang de lta bu'i rnam par grol ba'i 'jug pas zhugs so //
analyzed: bdag kyang de lta bu'i rnam par grol ba'i 'jug pas zhugs so //
translated: I have entered that very mode of liberation.

original: @325b bdag kyang de lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'jug pas zhugs so //
analyzed: @325b bdag kyang de lta bu'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'jug pas zhugs so //
translated: I have entered that very mode of the realm of phenomena.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bud med de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bud med de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to that woman, “Great being,

original: che zhe / theg pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa rnams dang / rtags gang yin pa rnams dang / mtshan ma gang dag yin pa 'di lta bu dag bdag la ston pa las na /
analyzed: che zhe / theg pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa rnams dang / rtags gang yin pa rnams dang / mtshan ma gang dag yin pa 'di lta bu dag bdag la ston pa las na /
translated: since you have shown me the aspects of the vehicle, the signs, and the indications,

original: khyod ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par the tshom med do //
analyzed: khyod ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin par the tshom med do //
translated: You have no doubt entered the Great Vehicle.

original: bud med des smras pa /
analyzed: bud med des smras pa /
translated: The woman said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: theg pa chen po'i rnam pa rnams dang / rtags rnams dang / mtshan ma rnams mkhyen tam /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rnam pa rnams dang / rtags rnams dang / mtshan ma rnams mkhyen tam /
translated: do you know the aspects, marks, and signs of the Great Vehicle?”

original: smras pa / che zhe /
analyzed: smras pa / che zhe /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: nyan thos kyis ni ma thos par theg pa chen po'i rnam pa rnams dang / rtags rnams dang / mtshan ma rnams shes par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis ni ma thos par theg pa chen po'i rnam pa rnams dang / rtags rnams dang / mtshan ma rnams shes par mi nus kyi /
translated: “Great Woman, the hearers cannot know the aspects, marks, and signs of the Great Vehicle without having heard about them.

original: che zhe; theg pa chen po'i rnam pa rnams dang / rtags rnams dang / mtshan ma rnams shod cig /
analyzed: che zhe; theg pa chen po'i rnam pa rnams dang / rtags rnams dang / mtshan ma rnams shod cig /
translated: Great Woman, please teach the aspects, marks, and signs of the Great Vehicle.”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: She said, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba de ni chags pa ma mchis pa'i theg pa dang / sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes dang / tha dad pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba de ni chags pa ma mchis pa'i theg pa dang / sgrib pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes dang / tha dad pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: the Great Vehicle is a synonym for the vehicle of nonattachment, the wisdom of nonobstruction, and the wisdom of nondifferentiation.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: dper na / las su 'gro ba'i lha'i bu rnams dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i gzhal med khang rnams ni sems can rnams la snang bar bgyi ba'i slad du chags pa ma mchis pa dang / sgrib @326a *//
analyzed: dper na / las su 'gro ba'i lha'i bu rnams dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i gzhal med khang rnams ni sems can rnams la snang bar bgyi ba'i slad du chags pa ma mchis pa dang / sgrib @326a *//
translated: For example, the celestial palaces of the gods who move in their heavenly vehicles and of the moon and sun are unattached and unobscured in order to illuminate beings.🔽

original: pa ma mchis pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par nam mkha' la shugs kyis mchi ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: pa ma mchis pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par nam mkha' la shugs kyis mchi ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the celestial palaces of the gods who travel on their work and of the moon and sun move unimpeded, unobstructed, and continuously through space in order to illuminate beings.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams ni sems can thams cad la chos kyi snang ba bgyi ba'i slad du chags pa ma mchis pa dang / sgrib pa ma mchis pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi shugs kyis mchi'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i skyes bu dam pa rnams ni sems can thams cad la chos kyi snang ba bgyi ba'i slad du chags pa ma mchis pa dang / sgrib pa ma mchis pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gi shugs kyis mchi'o //
translated: in the same way, the holy beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle move unimpeded, unobstructed, and continuously through the six perfections in order to illuminate all beings with the light of the Dharma.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: dper na / gling bzhi ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lags te /
analyzed: dper na / gling bzhi ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lags te /
translated: the four continents belong to a universal monarch.

original: de gang dang / gang du mchi ba de dang / der gling bzhi pa'i mi rnams kyis bsten pa'i 'os su 'gyur ba lags la /
analyzed: de gang dang / gang du mchi ba de dang / der gling bzhi pa'i mi rnams kyis bsten pa'i 'os su 'gyur ba lags la /
translated: Wherever they go, they are worthy of being attended upon by the people of the four continents.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'ang sems can de dag la bsam pa mi mnyam pa'i rnam pa ma mchis te byams par bgyid pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'ang sems can de dag la bsam pa mi mnyam pa'i rnam pa ma mchis te byams par bgyid pa de bzhin du /
translated: The universal monarch has no thought of partiality toward those beings, but loves them all.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang thams cad du gang dang / gang du mchis pa de dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang thams cad du gang dang / gang du mchis pa de dang /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattvas who have set out in the Great Vehicle are worthy of being attended upon by all sentient beings, wherever they go, in all towns, cities, villages, countries, regions, and royal palaces.

original: der sems can thams cad kyis bsten pa'i 'os su gyur pa lags la /
analyzed: der sems can thams cad kyis bsten pa'i 'os su gyur pa lags la /
translated: They are worthy of being attended upon by all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms shing tha dad du spyod pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms shing tha dad du spyod pa ma mchis so //
translated: They have an attitude of impartiality toward all sentient beings and do not behave differently toward them.

original: @326b byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsdu ba rnam bzhis sdud pa na sems can rnams la byams pa tha dad pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: @326b byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsdu ba rnam bzhis sdud pa na sems can rnams la byams pa tha dad pa ma mchis te /
translated: When bodhisattvas gather beings through the four means of gathering, they have no different love for sentient beings.

original: des na theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: des na theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni theg pa de che ba lags la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni theg pa de che ba lags la /
translated: the so-called Great Vehicle is a great vehicle,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams dang / brgya byin dang /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams dang / brgya byin dang /
translated: and is worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, Śakra,

original: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams dang / mkhas pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams dang / shes pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyis mchod pa lags te /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams dang / mkhas pa rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams dang / shes pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyis mchod pa lags te /
translated: Brahmā, the world guardians, the wise, the holy beings, the knowledgeable, those who have gone rightly, and those who have entered rightly.

original: des na theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: des na theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa de ni ma skyes pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni ma skyes pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is inexhaustible because it is unborn.

original: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is the lineage of the Buddhas.

original: theg pa de ni chos kyi rigs sdud pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni chos kyi rigs sdud pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is the lineage of the Dharma.

original: theg pa de ni dge 'dun gyi rigs yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni dge 'dun gyi rigs yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is the lineage of the Saṅgha.

original: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed cing sgrib pa med pa'i phyir yangs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed cing sgrib pa med pa'i phyir yangs pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is vast because it is open to all sentient beings and is free of obscurations.

original: theg pa de ni phan ma mchis pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni phan ma mchis pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is unconditioned because it is not beneficial.

original: theg pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis shin tu sbyang ba byas pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is well-trained by the six perfections.

original: theg pa de ni bsdu ba rnam bzhis legs par bsdus pa'o //🔽theg pa de ni 'phags pa'i @327a *//
analyzed: theg pa de ni bsdu ba rnam bzhis legs par bsdus pa'o // theg pa de ni 'phags pa'i @327a *//
translated: This vehicle is well-collected by the four means of gathering.

original: lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir shin tu yang dag par song ba'o //
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir shin tu yang dag par song ba'o //
translated: This vehicle is well-gone because it follows the noble eightfold path.

original: theg pa de ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgoms pas bzhon pa bzang po ldan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgoms pas bzhon pa bzang po ldan pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is well-endowed with a good mount because it cultivates tranquility and insight.

original: theg pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i phyir kha lo sgyur ba bzang po'i gnas so //
analyzed: theg pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi brjed pa'i phyir kha lo sgyur ba bzang po'i gnas so //
translated: This vehicle is a good guide, because it does not forget the applications of mindfulness and the mind of awakening.

original: theg pa de ni snying rje chen pos shin tu brtan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni snying rje chen pos shin tu brtan pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is very stable, because of great compassion.

original: theg pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis legs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis legs par gnas pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is well-established, because of omniscience.

original: theg pa de ni bdud thams cad pham par byas pas 'jigs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni bdud thams cad pham par byas pas 'jigs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: This vehicle is free from fear, because it has defeated all demons.

original: theg pa de ni shes rab kyi snang ba yang dag par ston pa'i phyir mun pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni shes rab kyi snang ba yang dag par ston pa'i phyir mun pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: This vehicle is free from darkness, because it illuminates with the light of wisdom.

original: theg pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sdud cing gsog pas shin tu 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sdud cing gsog pas shin tu 'byor ba'o //
translated: This vehicle is very prosperous, because it gathers and stores all roots of virtue.

original: theg pa de ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyis pa'o //
translated: This vehicle is worshipped by the world with its gods.

original: theg pa de ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rdzi ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rdzi ba'o //
translated: This vehicle cannot be defeated by any opponents.

original: theg pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: This vehicle is difficult for all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas to understand.

original: theg pa de ni ma dad pa rnams dga' bar bgyid pa'o //🔽theg pa de ni sdang ba rnams byams par bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni ma dad pa rnams dga' bar bgyid pa'o // theg pa de ni sdang ba rnams byams par bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle delights the faithless.🔽This vehicle generates love in the hateful.

original: theg pa de ni ser sna can rnams kyi gtong ba bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni ser sna can rnams kyi gtong ba bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle generates generosity in the miserly.

original: theg pa de ni tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams kyi tshul khrims bgyid pa'o //🔽theg pa de ni gnod @327b sems kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi bzod pa bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams kyi tshul khrims bgyid pa'o // theg pa de ni gnod @327b sems kyi sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi bzod pa bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle generates discipline in the immoral.🔽This vehicle generates patience in those who are malicious.

original: theg pa de ni le lo can rnams kyi brtson 'grus bgyid pa'o //🔽theg pa de ni brjed ngas pa rnams dran par bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni le lo can rnams kyi brtson 'grus bgyid pa'o // theg pa de ni brjed ngas pa rnams dran par bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle generates diligence in the lazy.🔽This vehicle generates mindfulness in the forgetful.

original: theg pa de ni sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams nye bar zhi bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams nye bar zhi bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle generates tranquility in the distracted.

original: theg pa de ni shes rab 'chal ba rnams kyi shes rab bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni shes rab 'chal ba rnams kyi shes rab bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle generates wisdom in the unwise.

original: theg pa de ni dbul po rnams kyi nor bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni dbul po rnams kyi nor bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle generates wealth in the poor.

original: theg pa de ni sdug bsngal rnams bde bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de ni sdug bsngal rnams bde bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: This vehicle generates happiness in the suffering.

original: theg pa de ni mkhas pa rnams mchog tu dga' bar bgyid pa'o //

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang / gzhan dag na ming tha dad pa dpag tu ma mchis te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang / gzhan dag na ming tha dad pa dpag tu ma mchis te /
translated: limbs of awakening, and eightfold noble path are also innumerable in other buddha-fields.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: rnam grangs des kyang ming thams cad ni ming ma mchis pa dang / kun brtags pa dang / yang dag pa ma lags pa de ltar rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang ming thams cad ni ming ma mchis pa dang / kun brtags pa dang / yang dag pa ma lags pa de ltar rig par bgyi'o //
translated: by this one of many explanations, all names should be known as non-names, imagined, and unreal.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis rigs kyi bu de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis rigs kyi bu de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to that son of a good family:🔽“Sons of a good family and daughters of a good family who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are rare in the world.

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams ni de na yon gnas 'di lta bu dag 'khod pa las na rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi bram ze dang / khyim bdag rnams ni de na yon gnas 'di lta bu dag 'khod pa las na rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa yin no //
translated: The brahmins and householders in Rājagṛha have gained a great gain in that such worthy recipients are present there.”

original: rigs kyi bu des smras pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu des smras pa /
translated: That son of a good family said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'jig rten na yon gnas gang lags pa mkhyen tam /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yon gnas gang lags pa mkhyen tam /
translated: do you know who are worthy recipients in the world?”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: ji ltar bdag gis spobs pa de bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis spobs pa de bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: “Son of a good family, I will teach you as much as I have confidence to do.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa /🔽dge ba'i chos @343a *//
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa / dge ba'i chos @343a *//
translated: Those who have moral discipline,

original: la zhugs pa /
analyzed: la zhugs pa /
translated: who are engaged in wholesome dharmas,

original: sems 'khrul ba med pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas yin no //
analyzed: sems 'khrul ba med pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas yin no //
translated: and whose minds are undeluded are worthy recipients in the world.”

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: He said, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: khyod kyis ji skad bstan pa de dag ni yon gnas yongs su rdzogs pa ma lags so //
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad bstan pa de dag ni yon gnas yongs su rdzogs pa ma lags so //
translated: those you have taught are not complete worthy recipients.”🔽Subhūti replied,

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of a good family,

original: yon gnas yongs su rdzogs pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: yon gnas yongs su rdzogs pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: What is a perfect recipient of offerings?

original: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'ang skye la /
analyzed: smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor sems can thams cad la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'ang skye la /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Subhūti, those who generate great love and great compassion for all sentient beings,

original: sems can gang yang mi dmigs pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
analyzed: sems can gang yang mi dmigs pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
translated: but do not apprehend any sentient beings at all, are recipients of offerings in the world.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi tshul mi gcod pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi tshul mi gcod pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
translated: Those who do not sever the continuity of the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, are recipients of offerings in the world.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba la brtson pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba la brtson pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
translated: Those who strive to eliminate the afflictions of all sentient beings, are recipients of offerings in the world.

original: ye shes mi zad pa dang / shes rab kyi zad pa dang / bsod nams mi zad pa dang / spobs pa mi zad pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
analyzed: ye shes mi zad pa dang / shes rab kyi zad pa dang / bsod nams mi zad pa dang / spobs pa mi zad pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
translated: Those who have inexhaustible wisdom, inexhaustible insight, inexhaustible merit, and inexhaustible eloquence, are recipients of offerings in the world.”

original: so so skye bo'i grogs mi bgyid la 'phags pa'i grogs bgyid pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
analyzed: so so skye bo'i grogs mi bgyid la 'phags pa'i grogs bgyid pa gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
translated: Those who are not companions of ordinary people but companions of noble beings are worthy of gifts in the world.

original: gang dag mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams kyi ye shes mthong ba rnam par @343b dag par 'gyur ba gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
analyzed: gang dag mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams kyi ye shes mthong ba rnam par @343b dag par 'gyur ba gang dag lags pa de dag ni 'jig rten na yon gnas lags so //
translated: Those who, merely by being seen, purify the wisdom-eye of sentient beings are worthy of gifts in the world.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi phyi bzhin du rtag tu 'brang ba'i lha nges pa lam zhugs pa gang yin pa des yon gnas kyi bstan pa 'di thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi phyi bzhin du rtag tu 'brang ba'i lha nges pa lam zhugs pa gang yin pa des yon gnas kyi bstan pa 'di thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: Then, the god who was a constant follower of the elder Subhūti, who had entered the path of certainty, having heard this teaching on those worthy of gifts, generated the mind set on unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi rkang pa la phyag btsal nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi rkang pa la phyag btsal nas /
translated: He bowed at the feet of the Venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bzod pa gsol te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bzod pa gsol te /
translated: and asked for forgiveness from the Venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: saying, Venerable Subhūti,

original: bdag khyod kyi slad bzhin du 'brang bar mi bgyid do zhes byas so //
analyzed: bdag khyod kyi slad bzhin du 'brang bar mi bgyid do zhes byas so //
translated: I will not follow after you.

original: de nas rigs kyi bu des lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi bu des lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the son of a good family said to the god,

original: lha; khyod ci'i phyir btsun pa rab 'byor la bzod pa gsol /
analyzed: lha; khyod ci'i phyir btsun pa rab 'byor la bzod pa gsol /
translated: “God, why do you ask for the forgiveness of the venerable Subhūti?”

original: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs kyi bu /
translated: He replied, “Son of a good family,

original: bdag lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du btsun pa rab 'byor gyi phyi bzhin du 'brangs kyang /
analyzed: bdag lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du btsun pa rab 'byor gyi phyi bzhin du 'brangs kyang /
translated: for twelve years I have followed the venerable Subhūti,

original: bdag gis yon gnas kyis bstan pa 'di lta bu sngon chad ma thos te /
analyzed: bdag gis yon gnas kyis bstan pa 'di lta bu sngon chad ma thos te /
translated: but I have never before heard such a teaching of the field of merit.

original: de bas na da ltar yon gnas kyis bstan pa 'di thos nas bdag lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas bdag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de bas na da ltar yon gnas kyis bstan pa 'di thos nas bdag lhag pa'i bsam pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas bdag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Therefore, now that I have heard this teaching of the field of merit, I have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with a superior motivation, and I have thought,

original: gang dang / gang na yon gnas kyi sa yongs su dag par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sdud par byed pa'i chos 'di lta bu dag thos par 'gyur ba de dang / der 'gro'o snyam mo //
analyzed: gang dang / gang na yon gnas kyi sa yongs su dag par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sdud par byed pa'i chos 'di lta bu dag thos par 'gyur ba de dang / der 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: ‘I will go to wherever I can hear such teachings as these that gather together the bodhisattvas who purify the field of merit.’🔽”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor lha de'i sems bskyad pa de la rjes su @344a *//
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor lha de'i sems bskyad pa de la rjes su @344a *//
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, knowing the thoughts that were in the mind of that deity, said this to that deity:🔽“It is so, deity!

original: yi rang nas lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: yi rang nas lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, having rejoiced in the thought of that god, said to him:

original: lha; khyod kyi sems sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po dag la btud pa de ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
analyzed: lha; khyod kyi sems sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po dag la btud pa de ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do //
translated: “God, you have well obtained the thought that bows to the vast buddhadharmas.

original: lha; bdag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sems snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: lha; bdag ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sems snang bar gyur te /
translated: God, I have had the thought of omniscience revealed to me,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod du ma gyur pas ci byar yang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi snod du ma gyur pas ci byar yang med do //
translated: but I am not a vessel for the buddhadharmas, so there is nothing I can do.

original: lha; gal te bdag sems rnam par grol bar ma gyur na ni bdag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhig mod /
analyzed: lha; gal te bdag sems rnam par grol bar ma gyur na ni bdag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zhig mod /
translated: God, if I had not been liberated in mind, I would have given rise to the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: lha; gzhan yang /
analyzed: lha; gzhan yang /
translated: God, moreover,

original: khyod kyi ni sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams thos par byed pa dang / thos pa rnams kyang chud mi za bar byed pa'i skyes bu dam pa 'di ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsten par bya'o //🔽de nas rigs kyi bu des lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyi ni sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams thos par byed pa dang / thos pa rnams kyang chud mi za bar byed pa'i skyes bu dam pa 'di ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsten par bya'o // de nas rigs kyi bu des lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: You should always rely on a spiritual teacher who is like this, who causes you to hear the Dharma that you have not heard and who causes you not to waste the Dharma that you have heard.

original: lha; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni 'grub par dka' ste /
analyzed: lha; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni 'grub par dka' ste /
translated: ” Then the son of a good family said to the god, “God, unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain.

original: de ni go cha ngan don tsam gyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //🔽lhas smras pa /
analyzed: de ni go cha ngan don tsam gyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so // lhas smras pa /
translated: It cannot be fully awakened to merely by donning the armor of a small amount of goodness.

original: skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa /
translated: ” The god said, “Good man,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par dka' ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'grub par dka' ba yin mod kyi /
translated: unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain.

original: 'on kyang ci nas bdag gis btsal ba don yod par 'gyur bar bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ci nas bdag gis btsal ba don yod par 'gyur bar bdag gis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, I will practice so that my search will not be fruitless.

original: smras pa / lha; khyod kyis ji ltar bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: smras pa / lha; khyod kyis ji ltar bsgrub par bya /
translated: ” He said, “God, how will you practice?

original: smras pa / @344b sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa las rab tu grol bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi phung po'i khur khyer ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
analyzed: smras pa / @344b sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa las rab tu grol bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi phung po'i khur khyer ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
translated: He replied, “It is to be accomplished in order to be impartial toward all sentient beings, to liberate all sentient beings from their afflictions, to carry the burden of the aggregates of all sentient beings, to ripen all sentient beings,

original: sdug bsngal thams cad rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de ltar bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de ltar bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and to realize all suffering.

original: rigs kyi bu des smras pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu des smras pa /
translated: ” The son of noble family said,

original: lha; sems can du 'du shes pa la ni sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa med do //
analyzed: lha; sems can du 'du shes pa la ni sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa med do //
translated: “God, there is no impartiality toward all sentient beings for one who has the notion of sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs par 'du shes pa la ni sems can thams cad rab tu grol bar byed pa med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs par 'du shes pa la ni sems can thams cad rab tu grol bar byed pa med do //
translated: There is no liberation of all sentient beings for one who has the notion of afflictions.

original: phung por 'du shes pa la ni sems can thams cad kyi phung po'i khur khyer ba med do //
analyzed: phung por 'du shes pa la ni sems can thams cad kyi phung po'i khur khyer ba med do //
translated: There is no carrying the burden of the aggregates of all sentient beings for one who has the notion of aggregates.

original: kun brtags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba can la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa med do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba can la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa med do //
translated: There is no ripening of sentient beings for one who has the notion of roots of virtue that are imagined.

original: bdag dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa la ni sdug bsngal thams cad rtogs par byed pa med do //
analyzed: bdag dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa la ni sdug bsngal thams cad rtogs par byed pa med do //
translated: There is no realization of all suffering for one who has the notion of self and other.

original: de nas lha de gdams ngag 'di bstan pas mthun pa'i chos rnams la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: de nas lha de gdams ngag 'di bstan pas mthun pa'i chos rnams la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: Then, through the teaching of this instruction, the god attained acceptance of phenomena in accordance with reality.

original: de nas lha des rigs kyi bu de la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir sgo khang der lha'i me tog sil mas gtor to //
analyzed: de nas lha des rigs kyi bu de la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir sgo khang der lha'i me tog sil mas gtor to //
translated: Then, in order to make an offering to that son of noble family, the god scattered divine flowers in the courtyard.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Venerable Subhūti said to the god,

original: lha; bdag gis khyod kyi bsam pa ma shes nas nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyi gtam byas te dga' ba skyed pa @345a *//
analyzed: lha; bdag gis khyod kyi bsam pa ma shes nas nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyi gtam byas te dga' ba skyed pa @345a *//
translated: “God, not knowing your thoughts, I spoke about the teachings of the hearers in order to bring about joy.

original: de khyod kyis kyang bzod pa gyis shig /
analyzed: de khyod kyis kyang bzod pa gyis shig /
translated: You should be patient with that.🔽”

original: de nas lha des 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha des 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the god said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: khyod la bdag phyag 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: khyod la bdag phyag 'tshal gyi /
translated: I pay homage to you.

original: sems can su'i tshod kyang ma 'dzin cig /
analyzed: sems can su'i tshod kyang ma 'dzin cig /
translated: Do not take the measure of any being.

original: sems can su la'ang rung ste bsam pa ma brtags par chos ma 'chad cig /
analyzed: sems can su la'ang rung ste bsam pa ma brtags par chos ma 'chad cig /
translated: Do not teach the Dharma to anyone without first examining their motivation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: ma thos pa ni sla yi byang chub 'dod pas nyan thos kyi theg pa thos pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ma thos pa ni sla yi byang chub 'dod pas nyan thos kyi theg pa thos pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: it is easy not to hear it, but it is not easy for those who seek awakening to hear the vehicle of the hearers.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: yun ring du bkres pa ni sla yi /
analyzed: yun ring du bkres pa ni sla yi /
translated: it is easy to be hungry for a long time,

original: kha zas dug dang 'dres pa zos pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: kha zas dug dang 'dres pa zos pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but it is not easy to eat food mixed with poison.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: de bzhin du ma thos pa ni sla yi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma thos pa ni sla yi /
translated: in the same way, it is easy not to hear it,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas nyan thos kyi theg pa thos pa ni de lta ma yin no //🔽de nas rigs kyi bu des kyang bud med kyi gzugs dang / kha dog snga ma ji lta ba de bzhin du bstan nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas nyan thos kyi theg pa thos pa ni de lta ma yin no // de nas rigs kyi bu des kyang bud med kyi gzugs dang / kha dog snga ma ji lta ba de bzhin du bstan nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: but it is not easy for those who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas to hear the vehicle of the hearers.”

original: btsun pa rab 'byor; bdag gis bsod snyoms ma phul gyi bar du re zhig gzhes shig /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor; bdag gis bsod snyoms ma phul gyi bar du re zhig gzhes shig /
translated: Then the son of a good family, having shown his previous female form and complexion, said to the venerable Subhūti, “Venerable Subhūti, please wait a moment while I offer this alms-food.

original: de nas bud med de rang gi khyim du song ste ro brgya dang ldan pa'i zas blangs nas phyir byung ste 'ongs nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas bud med de rang gi khyim du song ste ro brgya dang ldan pa'i zas blangs nas phyir byung ste 'ongs nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the woman went to her house, took some food with a hundred flavors, and came back. When she arrived, she said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: bsod snyoms 'di bzhes la 'dod chags dang bcas par yang ma mdzad @345b cig /
analyzed: bsod snyoms 'di bzhes la 'dod chags dang bcas par yang ma mdzad @345b cig /
translated: accept this alms-food, but do not be attached to it.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig /🔽zhe sdang dang bcas par yang ma mdzad cig /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig / zhe sdang dang bcas par yang ma mdzad cig /
translated: Do not be free from attachment.🔽Do not be angry.

original: zhe sdang dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig /🔽gti mug dang bcas par yang ma mdzad cig /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig / gti mug dang bcas par yang ma mdzad cig /
translated: Do not be free from anger.🔽Do not be ignorant.

original: gti mug dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig /
translated: Do not be free from ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas par yang ma mdzad cig /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas par yang ma mdzad cig /
translated: Do not be afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar yang ma mdzad cig /
translated: Do not be free from affliction.

original: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis sdug bsngal yongs su ma mkhyen /🔽kun 'byung ba ma spangs /
analyzed: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis sdug bsngal yongs su ma mkhyen / kun 'byung ba ma spangs /
translated: If the Venerable Subhūti has not fully understood suffering,🔽has not abandoned its origin,

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du ma bgyis /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du ma bgyis /
translated: has not manifested its cessation,

original: lam ma bsgoms na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig /
analyzed: lam ma bsgoms na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig /
translated: If you have not cultivated the path, then accept this alms-food.

original: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ma bsgoms /
analyzed: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ma bsgoms /
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, you have not cultivated the four applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ma bsgoms na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di gzhes shig //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ma bsgoms na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di gzhes shig //
translated: the four correct exertions, the four legs of psychic power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path, then accept this alms-food.

original: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis 'jig tshogs kyang ma dkrugs la bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam yang thob na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig /
analyzed: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis 'jig tshogs kyang ma dkrugs la bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam yang thob na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig /
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, you have not disturbed the view of the transitory collection, but have attained the path of the single way, then accept this alms-food.

original: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis ma rig pa ma bshig par rig pas rnam par grol ba mngon sum du mdzad pa dang / 'du byed zad par ma mdzad par 'dus ma byas la mngon sum @346a *//
analyzed: gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis ma rig pa ma bshig par rig pas rnam par grol ba mngon sum du mdzad pa dang / 'du byed zad par ma mdzad par 'dus ma byas la mngon sum @346a *//
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, you have not destroyed ignorance, but have actualized liberation through knowledge, and have not exhausted formations, but have actualized the unconditioned,

original: du mdzad pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rgyu la ma brten par rnam par grol bar gyur pa dang / ming dang / gzugs su sgro ma btags par khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa dang / skye mched drug la ma brten par rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid bsgoms pa dang /
analyzed: du mdzad pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rgyu la ma brten par rnam par grol bar gyur pa dang / ming dang / gzugs su sgro ma btags par khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa dang / skye mched drug la ma brten par rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid bsgoms pa dang /
translated: to be liberated without depending on the causes of consciousness, to transcend the three realms without reifying name and form, to meditate on the emptiness gate of liberation without depending on the six sense sources,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la ma brten par rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa bsgoms pa dang / tshor bar ma dmigs par rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa mngon sum du mdzad pa dang / sred pa ma dmigs par de bzhin nyid yongs su mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la ma brten par rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa bsgoms pa dang / tshor bar ma dmigs par rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa mngon sum du mdzad pa dang / sred pa ma dmigs par de bzhin nyid yongs su mkhyen pa dang /
translated: to meditate on the signlessness gate of liberation without depending on contact through the coming together of eye and form, to actualize the wishlessness gate of liberation without observing feeling, to fully understand suchness without observing craving,

original: len pa rlom sems su ma mdzad par len pa med pa kun mkhyen pa dang / srid pa mi 'byung ba'i tshul du yongs su mkhyen pa dang / skye ba mi skye bar yongs su mkhyen pa dang / rga shi brjod du med pa'i tshul du mkhyen pa de lta bur srid pa'i yan lag rnams kun mkhyen na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig /🔽gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyang ma gzigs /🔽chos kyang ma gsan /🔽dge 'dun la'ang mi rton na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig /
analyzed: len pa rlom sems su ma mdzad par len pa med pa kun mkhyen pa dang / srid pa mi 'byung ba'i tshul du yongs su mkhyen pa dang / skye ba mi skye bar yongs su mkhyen pa dang / rga shi brjod du med pa'i tshul du mkhyen pa de lta bur srid pa'i yan lag rnams kun mkhyen na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig / gal te btsun pa rab 'byor gyis sangs rgyas kyang ma gzigs / chos kyang ma gsan / dge 'dun la'ang mi rton na de lta na bsod snyoms 'di bzhes shig /
